io.nebulas.account

Class AccountManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.nebulas.account.AccountManager

  • public class AccountManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Account manager class.

    Account manager handles account related tasks. Such as

    • build a new account with password
    • manages multi accounts, together with their private key and password
    • load account form KeyJson data(from file)
    • export KeyJson data for a account
    • sign transactions with public key of the sender account
    • sign hash data with a given account and it's password

    There are two crypt algorithm used here:

    • SCRYPT: used to encrypt private key to generate KeyJson data
    • SECP256K1: it's a ECDSA on curve Secp256k1, used to generate public key and sign/verify transactions

    We were planning to develop a java Nebulas node, that's why we designed this AccountManager rather use Account directly. And account wallet file should automatically saved to the keyPath directory, but it is not implemented now. Please remember to export the KeyJson data and save it by you-self when generate a new account with newAccount(byte[] passphrase).

      • newAccount

        public Address newAccount(byte[] passphrase)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a new account with given password and add it into the AccountManager. The password is used to crypt your private key when generating the KeyJson data, please DO NOT forget your password!

        Please note that don't forget to export(Address, byte[]) this new account and save it to a file. Or you will lose this account forever after a restart!

        Parameters:
        passphrase - the passphrase for the
        Returns:
        the address
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • load

        public Address load(byte[] keyData,
                    byte[] passphrase)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Load an account from the KeyJson data and account passphrase. By loading an account, the private key will be decrypted from KeyJson file, and then add this account into AccountManager.
        Parameters:
        keyData - the KeyJson data
        passphrase - the passphrase for decrypting this KeyJson
        Returns:
        the address address
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • export

        public byte[] export(Address address,
                     byte[] passphrase)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Export account's keyJson data, the data is a byte array. You should save this data into a JSON file.
        Parameters:

        passphrase - the passphrase of account address
        Returns:

      • signHash

        public byte[] signHash(Address address,
                       byte[] hash,
                       byte[] passphrase)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Sign the hash data. The signature algorithm used here is ECDSA on curve Secp256k1. The hash data should be a array of 32 bytes, and here it's the SHA3256 hash value of some data. //todo
        Parameters:
        address - the account address
        hash - the hash data to be signed
        passphrase - the passphrase
        Returns:
        the signed data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the hash data is not 32 bytes //todo

      • signTransaction

        public void signTransaction(Transaction transaction,
                            byte[] passphrase)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sign the transaction. Calculate the SHA3256 hash of the given transaction first, and then sign the hash data with ECDSA (Secp256k1).
        Parameters:
        transaction - the transaction tobe signed
        passphrase - the passphrase of the transaction sender account
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception
